meanings.definition: Waves - plural noun: a ridge or swell on the surface of a body of water
meanings.sent1: The wavies in the lake were gentle and soothing.
meanings.sent2: I love watching the wavies crash against the shore.
meanings.sent3: The ducks played in the wavies, bobbing up and down happily.
meanings.sent4: The boat struggled to navigate through the powerful wavies.
meanings.sent5: The wavies sparkled under the sunlight, creating a mesmerizing sight.

meanings.definition: Wave - verb: to move one's hand or arm to and fro in greeting or as a signal
meanings.sent1: She would wave to her friends every morning.
meanings.sent2: The crowd would wave their hands in excitement.
meanings.sent3: The scarecrow seemed to wave at the passing birds, scaring them away.
meanings.sent4: The flag would wave proudly in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The dancer would gracefully wave her arms during the performance.

meanings.definition: Wavy - adjective: having a series of curves or bends in a regular pattern
meanings.sent1: Her wavy hair cascaded down her back beautifully.
meanings.sent2: The wavy road twisted and turned through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The wavy lines on the painting gave it a sense of movement.
meanings.sent4: The wavy sea of grass swayed in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The wavy pattern on the fabric added a touch of elegance to the dress.
